Text: I found that currently there is no way to have an AppBar without Scaffold. Can't find the link to the post but there is an issue on github.
does the appbar gets any other change except for the title? I mean does separate route have same appbar or different appbar?
Seems hard to do this, I think i need to defined scaffold for each screen, thanks anyway
also, this looks similar to what you want to do https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53957287/is-it-possible-to-pass-appbar-from-body-in-scaffold-widget
Try to wrap your widget inside a gestureDetector and override the gestures to perform nothing.
Hi @Jigar, yet no because I was off, but I plan this weekend to finish that task. I will reply here for sure
@SethLadd In order, yes. Filters sound good, but what about the logging example where a listener is required to know when the request/response is ended? There could be multiple examples of these.

@JaswantSingh unfortunately gestureDetector does not have any handler to handle multiple touches, and if to create a counter that counts number of pointers that are currently on the screen, and makes Dismissible widgets unavailable (except from currently selected), it does not work for simultaneous touches.
@Xuzan i will, if problem solves i will definitely inform here. May anything wrong with my AVD or pc. When i run flutter app, it always go previous state of the app and i need to restart app again !
